result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Mark B. Newberry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant must sign all necessary releases so that the State can contact Taylor County Human Services about whether the defendant is requesting and receiving voluntary mental health services.  Defendant must successfully complete the two year probationary period and all required conditions of his probation.  Defendant shall comply with all conditions of his bond.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement and on motion of the State, the Court granted a deferred entry of judgment for a period of two years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement, the State will move to dismiss the felony charge.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  Defendant shall submit to random drug testings as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall submit to an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin no later than April 8, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Arrest Report

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $500.00 cash bond with conditions of:   Defendant shall not consume or possess controlled substances.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Statement by DE.  Court ordered $200.00 cash bond and $1,000.00 signature bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for June 30, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. ba
